availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Ballard County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Thomas Woolfolk and Nancy Woolfolk. Married to Rebecca Hall Woolfolk in Ballard County, Kentucky, in March 1858. Father of Thomas P. Woolfolk, Laura O. Woolfolk, Ellen Woolfolk, and John J. Woolfolk. Farmer in Ballard County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ballard County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Ballard County in 1860. Farmer in Ballard County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, p. 266B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 593.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, Picketts District, p. 43A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ballard County, District 5, p. 438B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Ballard County, KY, June 1863, p. 48.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records - Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994027, Ballard County Marriages.
